articles.description: Arsenal and Manchester City win while Celtic concede seven in the Champions League plus build-up to Wednesday’s matches.
articles.title: Champions League reaction: Arsenal & Man City win, Celtic thrashed, Aston Villa, Liverpool build-up

articles.description: Brendan Rodgers' Celtic suffer again in Europe as they fail to learn lessons of old, writes Tom English.
articles.title: Celtic: 'Brendan Rodgers' naive side fall into familiar European trap'

articles.description: Arsenal forward Bukayo Saka says "this is the year" the Gunners end their 21-year wait for a Premier League title.
articles.title: Arsenal: Bukayo Saka says 'this is the year' Gunners end long wait for Premier League title

articles.description: Why Bangladesh women's team could lose once-in-a-generation boost to the sport in their country after T20 World Cup was moved to UAE.
articles.title: Women's T20 World Cup 2024: Bangladesh feel effects of move to UAE

articles.description: Sturm Graz, competing in the Champions League group stage for the first time in 24, have toppled Red Bull Salzburg in Austria thanks to a clear philosophy and a focus on scouting young talents.
articles.title: Sturm Graz: How Austrians ended Red Bull's title dominance

articles.description: Manchester United manager Erik ten Hag insists he has nothing "to panic about" after a poor start to the season.
articles.title: Manchester United: Erik ten Hag says recent form is 'nothing to panic about'

articles.description: Aryna Sabalenka extends winning streak to 15 matches to reach the China Open quarter-finals with a straight-sets victory against Madison Keys.
articles.title: China Open: Aryna Sabalenka beats Madison Keys to reach Beijing quarters

articles.description: Aston Villa face Bayern Munich, 42 years after beating the German giants to win the European Cup.
articles.title: Aston Villa: The night the underdogs beat Bayern Munich became European champions in 1982

articles.description: Sale Sharks and England fly-half George Ford is a doubt for the autumn internationals after suffering a torn thigh muscle.
articles.title: George Ford: Sale and England fly-half out with torn thigh muscle

articles.description: Phil Foden scores and gets an assist as Manchester City claim their first Champions League win of the season with a comfortable victory at Slovan Bratislava.
articles.title: Slovan Bratislava 0-4 Manchester City: Phil Foden on target in dominant win
